oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery Interviews Michael Martin Murphey - Parts 1, 2 and 3
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording is from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Michael Martin Murphey (performer) for the Ralph Emery Show. Tape labeled parts 1, 2 and 3. Recording is from November 12, 1984.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Michael Martin Murphey
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:05) Ralph Emery introduces Michael Martin Murphey and George Jones' "She's My Rock" -- (00:35) Emery inquires about why Murphey continuously uses his middle name and "Cherokee Fiddle" -- (05:19) Emery invites Mary Murphey to introduce the Oak Ridge Boys -- (05:36) Emery equates Murphey's style to Tom. T. Hall's when discussing the fiddle -- (07:17) Emery and Murphey explore why the fiddle is associated to the devil -- (09:06) Emery and Murphey discuss the peculiarity of recording around Christmas time and "Home Free" -- (13:53) Emery tells Murphey that Elvis Presley was born fifty years prior and asks Murphey about Presley's influence on him personally -- (15:43) Murphey praises Emmylou Harris while introducing "Someone Like You" -- (16:01) Emery asks Mary Murphey what it is like in New Mexico, and asks Murphey to reflect on "Love Affair" -- (17:32) Murphey tells that Mary had an influence on "Love Affair" -- (18:02) Emery says goodbye to Mary and Michael Murphey, and performs his commercial outros -- (18:37) Emery introduces Murphey; additionally, Murphey introduces Gene Watson's "Got No Reason to Go Home Now" -- (19:10) Emery introduces Mary and inquires about where she was from/how she met Michael -- (26:00) Emery introduces "Still Taking Chances" and Reba McEntire's "How Blue" -- (26:34) Emery reintroduces the Murphey's to discuss their dating history -- (28:35) Emery has Mary introduce Lee Greenwood's "You Got a Good Love Coming" -- (29:20) Murphey reflects on the hardships he had stemming from his failed marriages -- (31:41) Emery invites Murphey to introduce Crystal Gayle "Me Against the Night" -- (31:55) Emery invites Murphey to reflect on C. W. McCall, and Murphey recalls owning a C. B. radio -- (33:47) Mary reflects on Michael's personality; additionally, Michael discusses cooking -- (36:20) Michael recalls how Willie Nelson joined him in recording "The Rhythm on the Road" -- (36:47) Emery, Michael, and Mary say their goodbyes, and Emery does his sponsored outros -- (37:47) Murphey radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (37:59) Murphey radio spot for the Ralph Emery Show -- (38:08) Emery introduces Michael and jokes about the various Mikes I the studio -- (38:39) Emery invites Murphey to introduce "Will it be Love by Morning" -- (39:16) Emery inquires about Murphey's integration into living in Nashville, TN -- (43:28) Emery inquires whether or not the audience had seen the music video for "What She Wants" -- (44:09) Emery discusses how the other night he did a roast of Charley Pride -- (45:51) Emery inquires about Murphey's performance of "Radioland" at the CMA Award Show and its tribute to radio -- (49:09) Emery inquires about the last time Brenda Lee was at the show while introducing "Hallelujah I Love You So" -- (49:32) Emery leads Murphey to discuss how his son was lost for eight hours and missing children -- (53:49) Emery introduces "Mansion on the Hill" and has Murphey reflect on its personal meaning to him -- (54:52) Emery and Murphey say their goodbyes, and Emery does his sponsored outros
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Murphey, Michael, 1945-;
